question: Ethyl alcohol is heated with concentrated sulphuric acid at 413 K. The major product is
explanation: At 413 K (140°C), dehydration of ethanol with conc. <katex>$\text{H}_2\text{SO}_4$</katex> yields Diethyl ether (<katex>$\text{C}_2\text{H}_5\text{OC}_2\text{H}_5$</katex>).
At 443 K (170°C), it would yield Ethene.
